intro: Palala philippensis, commonly known as the Philippine palala, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as montane forests. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round fruits. Due to habitat loss, Palala philippensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
